body.p:
GUI developmentadd lineUse a dividing line to visually separate sets of widgets. Lines are one pixel thick. For a thicker line, use a filled region widget.
Use a Palette to add a divider to the canvas.
On the Basics page of the GUI Painter Tool, select either Horizontal or Vertical for the orientation property. Apply the property.
Use the widget handles to size and position the divider.
Install the canvas.

GUI developmentadd boxUse boxes to cluster widgets in logical groups. Box lines are one pixel thick. For a thicker line, use a filled region widget.
Use a Palette to add a box to the canvas, leaving the box selected.
Use the widget handles to size and position the box.
To provide a label, fill in the Label property field in the GUI Painter Tool.
Apply the change and Install the canvas.

topic.title: Add a region widget to a canvas

body.p:
GUI developmentadd regionUse rectangular and elliptical regions for grouping other widgets.
Use a Palette to add a region to the canvas.
On the Basics page of the GUI Painter Tool, select either Rectangle or Ellipse as the widgetâ€™s shape.
Set the desired Border Thickness property.
On the Color page, select any colors for the region.
Use the widget handles to size and position the region.
Apply the properties and Install the canvas.
To label the region, use a label widget.
